price.review: I have 3 kids under 4 all in car seats. My oldest is 4 and with him in the back of our van, it has been such a hassle to get him unbuckled because the actual latch  part needs so much to unlock it that he couldn't get it on his own.  He was able to buckle up without help, just not unbuckle. Within 2 minutes of installing the Bucklebee , my 4 year old had car seat independence and was able to unhook his car seat in seconds easily. Thank you for making such a amazing product that fixed such a frustrating problem for a mom at such a reasonable price. I'll be purchasing for my other children as they get older.

I think these were a great idea.  i will say it really depends on your carseats buckle strap size. My infant seat this fit fine and never fell off.  I put this onto my stage 2 car seat and it fell off 2x in the same day.  That is a problem for me so i have to figure this out. Overall for the price i wouldnt have bought this but i got excited one day and clearly didnt see the price of $17. I think this would be good for an older child who CAN HELP YOU by getting themselves out of the seat

Had to find something so that grandma who has loss of feeling in her fingertips could unbuckle my twin girls'  car seat buckles.  She had been unable to pick the girls up from preschool or drop them off in the past as she couldn't do the car seats.  Now, with this, she can do it!  Such a simple concept and design, but it works.  Only thing I don't like is the price, it literally is a formed hard piece of some sort of plastic that just acts as a lever.

Its literally a little piece of plastic so I find the price ridiculous. However, it works great for my almost 5 year old. Needed a way for her to undo her car seat buckle herself for kindergarten drop off and she learned how to use it quickly.
This product did not work! Waste of money.

Yay! My 4 yr old can now unbuckle his Graco Tranzitions by himself. Were both happy. The price point is a little higher than I think is worth it, but....what are you gonna do?! I would buy another for the functionality.
My 5 year old has low hand strength and this gives him the leverage to release his own car seat buckle.  4 stars because I feel it's overpriced.
This did not work for us at all! The part meant to push the red release button was not in the correct position and was therefore useless. A $15 paperweight....
This thing is super overpriced but necessary for a momma with long nails

Although it helps, my 5-year old sometimes still has trouble unbuckling with this. The quality doesn't seem to worth $15 - I can't imagine it costs nearly that much to manufacture. Please make this more reasonably priced.
My 5 year old got the hang of it after a few tries! So helpful especially when hes in the third row in our minivan. A little more expensive than I really wanted to spend

Doesn't fit, it's too small to reach the button for my grandsons seat so gave it to his mom to try on hers. Should return it but didn't save the packaging. Really was expensive for what it is! Anyways hoping it'll work on my grandsons seat in his moms car at least.
Expensive for a piece of plastic, but may be worth it to parents who want one less thing to do when managing your kid.

This Bucklebee is sooo helpful for getting child out of restraint!  I am a grandma who has three car seats in my van at all times.  I was having trouble with my thumbs/wrists and this thing is a tremendous help.  I think it is expensive for something that is the equivalent of a plastic bottle opener, but I am very glad to have found it and like that it can attach to the buckle strap and not get lost. I would recommend it even though it is pricey.
My 5 year old quickly & easily gets out of his car seat with this gadget. Seems pricey for what it is but it works well. Wish I'd invented it!
A little pricey but TOTALLY worth not having to climb in the backseat to help unbuckle my kids anymore! My 3&4yr olds figured this thing out SUPER quick, highly recommend!!
This feels a little expensive at $15 but its totally worth the money so that your preschooler can undo his own own car seat.

I have three kids in car seats.  We purchased one bucklebee for our oldest son who is 5 and is responsible enough to know not to unbuckle when we are driving. It's been amazing to have one less kid to unbuckle! Our other kids are begging for one, so we purchased a second to give our daughter for Christmas. Honestly, it will probably be her favorite present. lol  I find the price is a little steep...but it really did save a lot of hassle.

It was getting harder for us to release the buckle on our grandchildren's car seats due to arthritis. This device has made it very easy. It also allows our almost 6 year old grandson to get himself out. I think the price is a bit high for a piece of plastic. If you need help releasing car seat buckles this will do the job

*** Update 2-4-20 *** I still really like the Buckle Bee, however Im taking off one star because the device will occasionally come off the strap which is useless for my daughter to unbuckle herself. Weve had it for a couple months now and its unattached twice. Its mostly just inconvenient and not a reason to stop using it, but at the $15 price point I feel like it shouldnt become unattached so easily. *Original review* I really like this gadget. My daughter is almost 5 and is mature enough to know to only use the device when she is supposed to get out of the car. I feel like $15 is slightly expensive for this small piece of plastic. $10-$12 would be a better value. The other versions which cost less dont have very good reviews though. This product makes my life easier and makes my daughter feel more independent so Ill give it the full 5 stars.
Broke within a two months

This made it so much easier to unbuckle the car seat buckle, especially since I developed wrist tendinitis.  However I think the price is a little pricey.  I would recommend it but only if the price was lower

My 6yo is still in a 5 point harness and he had to wait for someone to get him out which often caused quarrels among siblings. I saw a similar idea online that cost more and went on Amazon looking forward something more affordable. This definitely fit the bill
Very hard plastic, pictures make it look more like a silicone/rubber. I would recommend adding some kind of grip texture to it but it is easy to use if it is attached to the seat.

Little pricy for a piece of plastic, but definitely helps with your sanity from having to go back to the third row and helping unbuckle. My 4 year old can easily unbuckle herself when we are parked and ready to exit the vehicle. Without this, Id have to crawl/ squeeze my way through the third row.

durable.review: Bucklebee where have you been all of my child bearing years??  I am so glad to find this amazing tool. My little guy is very small for his age, and does not have the strength to unbuckle his car seat by himself. This frustrates him so much, because he likes to be the first one in the house.  He has to wait for me to unbuckle him before he can jump out. This also means that if it is raining (in WA we get a LOT of rain), I get extra wet bending through the backseat and over his sisters seat, to wrestle with his buckle. These are all problems of the past because our Bucklebee arrived quickly with Prime Shipping.  It was super easy to install, just slip one end through and wiggle it a bit to get the other end through. My guy eagerly jumped in and buckled himself up. It took a few times of practice before he "got" it. It did work best unbuckling one strap at a time, for his tiny little hands.  I am sure as he grows and has more practice it will be like second nature to him. Bucklebee is made of a nice thick material, and I have no worries of it breaking. I love how it attaches to the buckle between the legs. NO chance of it getting lost in the car. I am super happy with our Bucklebee!

We've been using the Bucklebee for almost 2 years - amazing product! They are easy to install and very easy for children to use (when they are capable of understanding when it is appropriate to unbuckle their own harness). My oldest has a drop off line for school and since purchasing this product, she's been able to safely get herself out of the carseat without assistance. The product is sturdy and the bright color makes it easy to locate. It's also easy to reposition so it never gets in the way if you need to manually release the seat buckle. I would highly recommend the Bucklebee for anyone looking to make their car trips with young children a bit easier on the whole family!
My 4 year old boy is now more independent. We use it on his Diono Radian. Works great and stays on the buckle.
Works great for my 6 year old to get herself out of the career. I love it because I am able to keep her harnessed as long as possible.
Worth every penny. If we ever lost ours I would replace it again and again. It makes our 5 year old so much more independent.

We love this!! Its come in handy with 2 of my kids already. We bought it for my daughter when she was 4 and knew when it was ok to unbuckle herself but wasnt able to. This helped her to be able to do it herself when dropping her off at preschool, or just any time to make life a little easier for me. Once she was strong enough to unbuckle herself we passed it down to her younger brother and he likes being big enough to handle it himself as well. Its well made and will last forever so well be passing it down to our next child too.

Tremendous! Been in use for more than a ear, saves time every trip as child can get out of seat without help ow.  Great for self esteem and sense of independence. Used myself after hand surgery weakened grip.  They should mare let it to grandparents who help drive kids and to adults as an aid for any condition, like arthritis, that can limit grip strength.  Bought as gifts for extended family, too. As mentioned in product details, evaluate whether your child understands when they can unbuckle and when they should not before using.

This product is a game changer if you have hands that hurt.  I have arthritis and could barely get my granddaughter our of her car seat until getting this product!  I stays connected to the latch so no risk of losing it.  LOVE, LOVE, LOVE.

Where has this been since our oldest was 5!?!? Works how its suppose to!! Our youngest son whos 5, loves that he can get out on his own once were parked. :) AND I want to add that I just had Great, exceptional customer service from BuckleBee!!! Thank you so much!
I like that it works. I dislike that it looks like an exposed phallus on my child.

This little contraption was very easy to install and stays on the buckle strap of the car seat very well. It is made of very durable plastic. My 4 year old knows just how to use it but sometimes lack the strength to fully unbuckle but she'll get better at it. In my opinion, it's a great product but there are some people - both parents and non-parents - who bash this thing. First of all, they'll claim that it voids the manufacturer warranty of the car seat - not true. This does not void any sort of warranty of the car seat. Second, they claim that your child can easily unbuckle themselves while you're driving down the road, thereby making this a very dangerous product. This is a parenting problem - if your child is already prone to unbuckling themselves when they are not supposed to, then this product is obviously not for you. Don't buy it. Fact is, it makes unbuckling easier for your child and gives them a little more independence and responsibility. My wife loves it because it makes drop off at school much more efficient. We've had it for a month now and had no problems whatsoever with it.
More yellow than green like the pic looks but doesnt matter what color! Matters that it works for my weak hands. I always have issue pushing in the button.

Nail saver !!! Life saver !  Im sure everyone has experienced breaking a nail. It literally feels like your souls leaves your body. So unbuckling a baby from a car seat without the bucklebee with long nails is terrible. I love that it stays on the car seat because i would end up losing it if it didnt. As a parent one less item to keep track of that stays in the needed place is the best. I ended up buying another one for my husbands car seat. Its durable and easy to use.

This thing is amazing! I bought two, because this item had lower reviews and I wanted to make sure what I got worked.  But I loved the idea that the buckle bee stays on the seatbelt latch and doesnt have to be stored on a keychain or in a door pocket. Tried the other one first-  it worked but was such a pain to get around the bulky lower buckle latch that I knew it wasnt going to work for my kids. I have three kids and we just found out were having twins! So its VITAL that my older ones can get my toddler out on their own lol. With that in mind, I pulled out the buckle bee next and put it on the lower latch belt- super easy, even with my car seat latch being very bulky. WORKS LIKE A CHARM. Even my toddler can operate it when shes told to! I love this thing- dont know why other versions of unbuckle helpers are even purchased instead. The plastic is thicker and seems more resilient than the other (very popular) product I tried, its super cute with the little bee, and you dont have to take it off and store (and lose) it! Unless you need to for a toddler that can do it themselves at inopportune times! ;) as a disclaimer, my kids are unusually highly coordinated ;)) lol! Super stoked about this Buckle Bee and will definitely recommend!
Haven't broken any nails!
We had another device for unbuckling but my son broke it in half. This one is much simpler and easier to use, plus it clips onto the buckle and it is not easy to break it in half.
Never have to worry about breaking a thumb nail again. Saves from having to jam your thumb way into the buckle button.
Does exactly what it says it will do. Worked on the 1st try for my children. Especially helpful in quick unbuckle moments like school drop-off.
I like what the manufacturers had in mind but it does not work easily...sorry!  The part itself seems durable but not so useful
Sturdy. Easy to use. Helpful!!

Slips on easily, stays on. I haven't had to put it back onto the clip once since I got it. My 4.5 yr old can now unbuckle herself from her 5 point harness seat. She will probably still be in a 5 point for kindergarten,  so I wanted her to be able to unbuckle herself easily to get out of the car. It is also great for days when my hands aren't working well due to medical issues, or when my nails are too long.
Does what it says it does. Which is great.
It works
I totally love this bucklebee! It makes unstrapping so much easier! Sturdy plastic, great product!

I originally purchased these because I have  acrylic nails and struggle to unbutton the car seat. This was the only one I found at the time that attached to a seat so it wouldnt be lost. With 3 kids and 2 old enough to unbutton themselves this is a life saver!! On  memorial day 2019 I T-boned a drunk driver that cut me off. The bystanders that came to help me and my kids while I was  unconscious were 2 elderly couples. They all said the only reason they were able to get my kids out was because of the bucklebee attachment. Their arthritis is too bad to do it without the extra help. They even told me later that they were ordering some for their grandchildrens car seats in their own cars! I cant rave enough about how much I love this product!!!
Sometimes it slips off the seatbelt but it does not cause any safety concern when it does. It definitely makes undoing the buckle earlier and I dont break my nails anymore!

Its nice not having to unbuckle my 4 year old while her 6 year brother can. She was always irritated that she was trapped while her brother was already unbuckled and out the car and still had to wait for me to get out the car to help her. Of course this wont be for the children who tend to unbuckle when they want, OBVIOUSLY. Been using this for a while now no problems.

We just got a mini van and it's not as easy for me to reach back and unbuckle him easily.  Typically at home I can just get out and walk around.  But he also likes to be self sufficient.  He is 5 and capable of knowing when he can unbuckle.  It's become more needed for school drop offs where I can't just hold up the line to jump out of the car myself.  I like this version as it stays clipped to the buckle rather than one that is supposed to go on my key chain or stored separately as that would just get lost on day 1.  It's easy to use and won't get lost.  Perfect to give your child some independence in unbuckling
My 5 year old still cant unbuckle herself with this. If anything it actually makes it more difficult.

Purchased this item as a replacement to one we thought we lost. This one seems to stay in place better since the part that goes around the buckle has a smaller opening. Its easy enough for the child to just push and release the latch. Thats what was most important as they have to unload themselves at school.

I have a very responsible 5-year-old whom I can trust.  For a while now, he has been able to buckle himself into his car seat.  He was getting very frustrated with not being able to unbuckle himself when we stopped.  The Bucklebee is the solution to our problem.  He can now unbuckle himself!  We still monitor to make sure that he doesn't unbuckle when he isn't supposed to.  We've had the conversation that if he does unbuckle before we tell him to, we take the Bucklebee away and make him wait like we used to.  He hasn't once tried to unbuckle while we're driving.  He hasn't once unbuckled (wth permission) and tried to exit the car before we told him to.  He is so proud that he can unbuckle himself in the car line at school or at church, or at the store. I was nervous at first.  Would it slip and unbuckle him without us knowing?  No, it will not.  You have to deliberately lift and squeeze to operate the Bucklebee.  Will it unbuckle him in the case of an accident?  No.  We have a convertible Graco and the way the Bucklebee attaches to the strap, you have to pull up and then in.  The little "plunger" that presses the button sits below the entire buckle until you move it.  Will I put this on my 2yo's car seat?  No, not yet.  However, these are made of thick, durable material that I feel will last until the little one is old enough to use it.  I am happy to recommend the Bucklebee to anyone who can trust their kid to not unbuckle themselves when it's not safe to do so.

So being a dad, i am mostly okay getting those ultra tough buttons to unbuckle the child safety seats. However, when other family members such as grandma, mom, or aunts need to get my child out, it can be a very painful process for them. That's where this product comes in, and it is a godsend. There are others that are a key chain of sorts and that's fine. But for this to actually clip into the buckle itself, there is a definite convenience. It feels durable enough to last through the entirely of my childs', well, childhood. For sure I will be getting one for any future children. I also highly recommend this for baby shower gifts, and etc. As far as value goes, the price may seem steep initially, but after many months of use and appreciating the design and function, I can say with confidence that it is very well worth the price.
Easy to set up and my daughter loves this. Very durable.
This product works great. I was nervous it would come off the bottom buckle when my child got in and out of their seat, but it stays put!
This has been so useful for my 4 year old to get out of his seat on his own!! Easy to use and sturdy!

easy.review: Easy to use and install
Bought for DD and she loves being able to let herself out of her car seat. Easy to use for little hands.

My son calls this his unbuckler.  It makes it super easy for him to get his buckle undone when we get stopped.  However, because it is so easy to use I won't get my 3 year old one any times soon.  I am too worried he would unbuckle while we were moving.  If your kid is trustworthy and just needs a little help getting that buckle undone get this - you will be so glad you did!

We have been trying to teach our 5yr old how to unbuckle in preparation for moving to the back row of the van when new baby arrives. After a lot of practice she was able to get the chest clip, but never the bottom. She would get so frustrated and eventually ask for help. I put on her bucklebee and she was able to unbuckle on her first try! She was so happy. It is very easy to use. Of course only use for children that are old enough to know when they are allowed to unbuckle. The only thing I would change is more color options.
Super easy with a 3yr old 1yr old and nb. Its awesome the 3 yr old can unbuckle her self!
Very easy for my daughter to use and a huge time saver when we are dropping her off at school!

So much easier now to get my daughter out of her car seat and she's much happier too! I always felt like I was pushing on her belly when trying to push the buckle release. So easy. Stays out of the way when not in use. I've given them as baby shower gifts because I really think every car seat needs one.

My kids are becoming more and more independent, this super easy to use device helps them get out of the car seats all by themselves! Takes about 10 sec to install, and its made in America! Great Product!
My kiddo loves being able to get out of the car on her own. So easy for her to use.

This little gadget has transformed our morning routine for the better. Recommended! It doesn't stay in place very well, but it's so easy to use that I don't mind. It's probably because the buckle strap on our carseat is thin,  not because of the Bucklebee.
Very easy for my four year old son to use!

The bucklebee has been a life saver for the School pickup line. My 5yo daughter has pretty weak hands and after a couple of practice tries, she has the bucklebee down. It is easy to put on and take off, even my daughter can do it. After using for several weeks, I dont see how there would be a possibility of it unbuckling the buckle on its own or my daughter doing it on accident.
Easy to put on, easy for my four year old to use. Unbuckled himself in seconds first try.
Easy to use and works as described.
Simple and effective.  It allows toddlers to get out of the buckle by themselves.  One should also teach them and practice getting out of the car via the non child locking doors in an emergency.
Makes getting my grandson out of his car seat so easy. I push he pulls on the straps and he is out. Helps him feel more actively involved in his care.
My 4yr old is so happy! It was so easy to install and easy enough for him to be able to use it! It also helps me with my long nails!

Love it! If your kiddo can button their shirt, then they can probably operate this. It has made getting in/out of the car so much easier. I wanted to keep my kiddo in a harnessed booster longer to be safer, but didnt want to limit our mobility from the car. This solves that.
Works just like it says, super easy to use.
Stress saver? I have my nails done all the time and would stress and get irritated trying to unbuckle my little one with my long nails. With this, it's super easy and fast!

Seriously a great purchase!! My daughter is 5 and just not strong enough to push her carseat latch, this is sooo easy & simple to use! She was so proud of herself as soon as she used it. By the way she is a great listener & that is definitely important since I know younger kids might unbuckle themselves randomly. But I would buy this over & over again! Its one of those must haves for our family!

I have a 4.5 year old son and it is kind of a pain having to always unbuckle him. We also wanted to move him to the back row of our suburban. He just isnt strong enough to undo that red button (but he is old and responsible enough to not do it when hes not supposed to). This is the perfect solution to our problem! It was so easy to put on, Im talkin seconds! And he can now unbuckle with ease! Yay!
This was easy to install. My 5 year old appreciates being able to unbuckle himself. Good product.

I had to get my daughter a new car seat after hers expired. The new one had a push button to open and was next to impossible to push. I started looking for something to help and came across this product. This is fantastic and is so simple to use. No more pain from trying to release her buckles!

This one works great because it attaches to the buckle, so little ones lacking the finger size/strength to use other options have no issues with this design. My 6yo is now completely self service both in and out of his car seat, which is in the corner of the 3rd row. The price is too high for what this is, in my view, but the function is 5 stars for sure
I bought this for my 5yr old son and he loves that he can unbuckle his own seatbelt its really easy to install and use
So much easier for my son to get himself nickeled and unbuckled in the car on his own

Got this product due to me really wanting to get my nails done. And thank goodness I did! Very easy to place on. I will admit my son takes it off now and then and places it in weird spots. So I wish it actually snapped together some how. Reason why for 4 stars, other then that it comes in handy!
This is perfect for my 5 year old to unbuckle himself.

Grest product. Super easy to use .

Purchased for my 4 yr old to get out of his car seat! So easy for him to use!

Love this! Makes it so easy for my 4yo to get herself out of her seat. I would NOT put this on a seat when the child doesnt get understand the importance of staying buckled until mom says its okay to unbuckle!

our son is old enough and responsible enough to know when to unbuckle, but with his 37 lbs just not strong enough - this easy to use tool is not only a big help for him to unbuckle, it's helping him to be independent, to be a 'big boy' and I see a big boost in his self esteem!

Easy to "install", easy for both my 4 and 2 year olds to use, easier for me, easy for my elderly mother who otherwise could not unhook the kids from their car seats. I'll be buying more for her car now too, along with car seats, since she will actually be able to pick up the kids now!!!

I Love it! My daughter can unbuckle her seatbelt easily. I thought it wouldnt work out but it was super easy. She is 4 years old and since i have a 1 yesr old and a 1 month old i got it so my 4 year old can help me out by unbuckling herself. She loves it and feels important. Good purchase.

I dont know how that could be remedied, but I dont think it bothers him any more than just being in the car seat does. Its worth it to me to not have to struggle!!
Bought to use in my car for my granddaughters. My hands just couldn't! Easy to attach and so much easier on my hands. Now my oldest granddaughter loves that she can undo her own car seat.
four year old can unbuckle herself
My 4 year old son loves that he can unbuckle by himself now! It's super easy and safe! (As long as the child knows not to do it while driving!)

My 7 year old love this! She has a hard time getting out of her car seat and this is so easy and simple for her! If something ever happened  to me  and I couldnt get her out of the car seat I know have the peace of mind knowing she can help herself!
This is easy for my mother and 5 year old to use.
This product is easy for both someone with arthritis and a responsible preschooler to use.

Perfect for our 5 year old. Quick and easy install on the buckle and he was able to work it on the first try. Makes getting out of the car much quicker since he can unbuckle while we are walking around the car to open his door. He loves the independence.

Best thing for easy drop for my 6 yr old and 4 yr old.. they unbuckle and are ready to jump out of the car in minutes after shutting the car off. They are old enough to know when and when it is not ok to unbuckle so it may not be for little ones.

Absolutely love this product.  We got when my daughter turned 5.  She is almost 6.  She is able to easily unwrap her bottom strap of her 5 point harness.  It is not hard she just pushes down and it easily unwraps without hurting her or pushing too much against her.  She loves she is able to get herself out. quality.review: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. I have a 4 year old and a 1 year old. It is always a chore having to unbuckle one baby, then walk to the other side of the car and unbuckle the other with the baby in your arms. When I saw a video of this product I knew my life would be just a little easier every day. As soon as I received it, I put it on my 4 year old's Britax car seat, it fit right into place in about 15-30 seconds. I strapped in the 4 year old and told him to try to unbuckle the car seat himself. Within 5 seconds he had popped open the bottom latch and unbuckled the top which he already knew how to do. If you saw the surprise and smile on his face you would buy the product just to see your child's reaction. Now whenever we get to our destination he pops open the buckles and waits at the door for us to open it for him. You never realize how much something so simple can add to your quality of life. My wife was so happy she asked me to order one for each of the cars and for the grandparents car. I was so happy I actually reached out to the designers to tell them thank you, something I had never done before. In summary, if you child can unbuckle the top buckle, then with this product they can also unlatch the bottom buckle. It is simple and safe. It even had to go through a crash test process to ensure it conforms to safety regulations. I have attached a quick video to show you how it works. I give it my highest recommendation.

This is probably one of the best things I have ever bought! I received this in the mail today. I took my 5 year old out to the car and attached this to her buckle. Usually she has trouble pushing the button to unbuckle herself. With this product installed she was able to get herself out within seconds! She was so excited that she was able to unbuckle it all by herself. She knows she is not allowed to push it while the car is in motion and only when mommy or daddy says she can do it. I really do recommend this product to anyone with an older child who is still in a 5 pt harness. It is the biggest lifesaver for a mom with 2 younger children in car seats. When my son is old enough to use this product I will definitely be installing it on his seat too! Thank you for this great product. Two very enthusiastic thumbs up. A+++++++++

This product is incredible! Something so small has made a huge impact on our daily lives. My husband has one arm and only two fingers and was therefore unable to unbuckle our son's car seat. He had previously used a very small vice grip with our infant car seat but given the angle of the larger car seat, this was no longer an option. There are a lot of accommodations and aids for disabled children (awesome!) but very few that I have found for disabled parents, specifically those with only one arm. After a ton of research I found the Bucklebee and ordered it hoping it would be what we needed. This morning was the first time he used it and he was able to unbuckle the car seat without issue. This is a task a lot of people take for granted but something my husband wouldn't be able to do without this ingenious aid. This product is certainly useful for an older child to get out of their car seat on their own but for anyone with limited strength or dexterity or for those who want to get their child out of the car seat easily (those buckles are tough!) this is a must buy!

Perfect product. I have 4 children, ages 5 & under. I drive a minivan and all 4 children are in the Peg-Perego 5-point harness seats. My almost 5-year-old son has difficulty releasing his car seat buckle by himself. I have to climb over seats to reach him and release his seat. He is mature enough to know when and when NOT to unbuckle himself. He only unbuckles when I give him permission. I "installed" the Bucklebee on his seat today and he released the buckle on the first try! HIGHLY recommend this product for older children that sit in the back of a van or SUV. This will definitely make my life easier! Thank you, Bucklebee!

I have R/A in my hands.  My granddaughter is eleven months old, so we have years of car seats a head of us.  I'm so pleased with how well the Bucklebee works.  I've used it on the stroller buckle as well!

I ordered two of these: one for my 5 year old and one for my 3 year old.  Neither child is strong enough to unatch their own seat belts on their own but both will need to be in 5 points for a while due to size.  The 5 year old rides in the third row of my van and it is very hard to squeeze back there to unlatch her seat belt everytime we stop.  This is exactly what we needed!! This is only for children who will not take off their seat belt unless told to because once they learn how to use it, they can!  My two children love being able to help me out now!  As for the safety questions, there is no way this is going to come off during a crash nor will my child hit their head on it like I have seen people asking.  This will also not magically unlatch the seat belt on its own.  It must be pressed and held down while pulling the buckles out.  It is a simple but effect tool and I'm glad we have it now!!

This is a miracle device!!!  I have severe arthritis in my hands and despite my determination to ignore the pain, could not push hard enough to release the buckle on my two-year-old grandson's car seat.  If my older grandkids weren't with me, I couldn't take him.  The Bucklebee changed all that.  This device demonstrated the meaning of "self-evident" to me. It is absurdly easy to slip it on the belt under the buckle, and just press up to release.  It is wonderful, wonderful, wonderful, and has changed everything for me in my attitude towards taking my grandson different places.....because I can get him out! The company goes to great lengths to warn users that the child in the seat must be responsible enough not to release themselves while you are driving, and I appreciate these warnings.  If my grandson decides he will experiment in the future, it will be no problem to keep the Bucklebee up front and just slip it on his seat belt when I need to get him out.  I wish the inventors of this product would think about creating other helps for people with little strength in their hands.  This is a winner, and I would recommend it to ANYONE who needs help with car seats. December 2016-- SET YOURSELF FREE WITH BUCKLEBEE! My grandson learned how to use the device about 4 months ago, just before he turned three.  He know that he's not allowed to release it until Grandma says, "Set yourself free with Bucklebee!"  He is so proud that he can use it.  This is one of my most important accessories in life.

This is a great tool to help your responsible child be independent. I have three boys ages 10, 6 1/2 and 2 1/2. My 6 1/2 year old is still in a 5 point harness, but because all my boys are in either a high back booster or 5 point car seat I have to distribute the boys in different rows of my Pilot. With that said my 6 year old sits in the far back and is not strong enough to unbuckle his bottom buckle so this is perfect for him. He follows the rules and never unbuckles unless he is told he can. We no longer have to ask our 10 year old to help get his younger brother's car seat undone. This product attaches easily and secure but is not permanently attached. It shouldn't effect a warranty or interfere with the safety features of the car seat itself. This is no different from other baby products such as mirrors or toys that attach to the handle. I feel it is safer than your child having loose toys, bottles or sippy cups floating about the car if an accident should occur. I higher reccomend this product. Great value for less hassle when loading and unloading children in and out of cars.

We love the Bucklebee!  Our 5 year old is a bit on the small side and will be in his 5 point harness for awhile. His new car seat has a release button that is far too stiff for him to unbuckle himself. He was getting very frustrated. The Bucklebee makes it so he can unbuckle all by himself, he loves it! This product is only intended for those children mature enough to know when it is and isn't appropriate to unbuckle. For instance, my 3 year old doesn't have one, he'd unbuckle while I was driving. This product saves me from having to crawl into the third row to unbuckle my 5 year old and provides him with independence! We love our Bucklebee!!!

My daughter is nearly 4, and very independent. She has been able to buckle herself, and then unbuckle her chest clip for a while now, but has been lacking the strength and dexterity to do the crotch buckle. I bought this not thinking it would work but that we would try. It arrived and my daughter was so excited to try it along with me and when she had no problem unbuckling thanks to this we both celebrated and did our happy dance! This is definitely for kids who are responsible enough to understand when it's safe and appropriate to unbuckle. It's a life saver and sanity saver!!!

This product is awesome! Having RA and little kids in car seats is difficult sometimes, so when I found this product I knew I had to try it. So glad I did. It has made my life so much easier getting my kids out of their seats on the days that my hands are just not strong enough to do it. My 4 year old can get out of her seat on her own now with the help of this device. It's awesome!

Simply stated, the device works as advertised. I showed my 3.5 year old how to use it once, helped her once, after that she was then able to get out of her car seat by herself from then on.  She was so full of pride, she even wanted to open and shut the car door herself.  She absolutely loves the Buckle Bee.

I bought this after my 4 year olater son started expressing interest in buckling himself in and getting himself out. It's a wonderful device for children seeking to be independent and we never once had the issue of him unbuckling himself while the vehicle was moving as we has extensive talks with him prior to installing.

This works so well for my 6 year old. He is in the third row and I can't always unbuckle him easily over the seat. With three boys in carsests this makes it much easier to get everyone out quickly. Absolutely love this product. I highly recommend it for older children 4+years! Great timesaver allows your child a little independence:)

Fantastic product!  I highly recommend to anyone with older children who can buckle themselves but aren't quite strong enough to unbuckle themselves.  It works fantastic for my almost 4 year old.  He sits in our 3rd row of our van and I used to have to climb over to unclip him, such a pain!  Now he easily does it himself.  I can't say enough good things about this product!  Order one!

This thing has been a life saver! We have a 3rd row SUV and 4 kids and we had to move our 4.5 year old son to the 3rd row. He can get himself all buckled in, but he just isn't quite strong enough to unbuckle himself, so we have to wait for the other kids to get out, fold down the seat, and then help him out. He LOVES being able to unbuckle himself now, and he always wants to show everyone that he can do it! Thank you so much to the Bucklebee team! <3

We purchased this for our 5 year old who is small and still in a 5 point harness. She loves being able to get out of her car seat and be independent.  What a great product for children who know they need to be buckled but are able to get out at the appropriate time!
I still have my son who just turned 5 in a five point harness and this helps him feel more grow up. Would highly recommend to others!

Excellent in Britax Frontier. My 5 year old just can't get the right angle to get his harness unbuckled. A friend who is a car seat expert suggested this. It installed in seconds and works like a charm!

I bought this for my 4 year old son. He is in a high back booster and could never unbuckle himself. After buying the bucklebee, it took him a few tries but once he figured it out he was so excited and proud of himself that he can get himself out of his seat now! I'm excited too! It is very easy to attach and I am very happy with this purchase.
This has been extremely helpful with our oldest kids!

The Bucklebee - Easy Buckle Release Aid for Children and Caregivers is a brilliantly designed piece of safety equipment that should be required with any child car seat sold. The device is easy to install or remove and easy to use. Proper guidance is critical for small passengers so they don't release buckles inappropriately. My five year old grandson can now extricate himself when necessary and he loves his new empowerment. It is also handy for any caregiver who may need to free a child normally or in an emergency and is durable. The price seems relatively absurd for a small piece of formed plastic, however, the function and enhanced safety make it a bargain.
This product has made my four year olds life so much easier. Then independence she feels is amazing. Makes quick in and out if the car trips so much easier
Live this contraption! It is hard for my son to use that has fine motor and low tone issues, but if your child has strong hands they will be able to do this no problems!

We are expecting another baby and with my large belly, it became annoying to have to unbuckle my son. We have had no behavior issues with him unbuckling, but he is almost 6 years old. Also makes it easier for grandparents to unbuckle him.

We love Bucklebee! I purchased this for my 3 1/2 year old daughter. Her carseat was moved to the back of our van. This little thing has changed my life :) it has given my 4 year old the independence he wanted and has given me a little break! Love it! Would buy over and over again!

This product has made my life so much easier. We purchased this when my son was still 5, he is 6 now. My son is now able to unhook his car seat belt himself. I got this for my son who is 6-years old.  He still sits in a 5-point harness.  i have 4 other kids including a 10-month old baby.  So getting out of the car can be a hassle. Since I have bought the Bucklebee, he can get himself out of his car seat without any issues.  He doesn't have to wait for me or anyone else to unbuckle him and he LOVES it! It has given him the freedom of a regular seat belt, but the safety of staying in his 5-point harness.  We couldn't be happier!  Thank You Bucklebee!!
I absolutely love this product. I have always struggled clicking the button. I have 4 year old twins, and they do not attempt to unbuckle themselves. I wish I would have found this product earlier!.
Works well. Helpful for my 4 year old.  I bought it in anticipation of moving her to the far back seat when baby #3 was on the way.  She is not overly strong, but was able to make this work.

Love this for my kids! Great invention and with kids sitting in my 3rd row it is so much easier to get them all in and out now!

These are awesome. We originally got one for our 5 year old who was moved to the back of the van when we had our baby. He loves it. Now we have bought one for our 3 year old and the older boy will let him out once we stop.
Super fast delivery. 5 yo loves being able to unbuckle himself when he is supposed to.

We got this so my daughter could get my son out of his car seat without us having to climb back every time. Saved us a lot of headache. He never got to a point to be able to do it himself but it was fine.

My 4.5yo is great at getting himself in the car, but couldn't undo the bottom latch to get out easily.  He's responsible enough to stay buckled during car rides, but it's great to allow him to be independent to get out by himself!
Works well!

I have a very trustworthy 5 year old who is still in a 5-point but has a lot of trouble with buckles. We've had this product for several months now, and it is going great. When we first got the bucklebee however, she could not manage it on her own at all. I had to have her try it every time she got out of the car and it took a few weeks before she was consistently getting it on her own. Maybe she wasn't strong enough, or maybe she just wasn't getting it in the buckle right. Regardless, we stuck with it and I'm glad because it saves me climbing into the back seat of our van every time she needs to get out. That being said, I definitely could not but this on my 2 year old's seat yet because he cannot be trusted to stay buckled when the car is still moving. You're just going to have to use your common sense and judgment for this.
Awesome
Love it!!! Its the best thing so i had gone to buy buy baby to buy it and they didn't know what I was talking about.

My almost 6 year old daughter is a very petite little girl so she is still in a f-point harness seat. She doesn't really like to because she couldn't get out by herself. This thing is amazing and she doesn't complain about being in the carseat as much anymore.

My husband is unable to pinch his fingers together tightly due to paralysis, which has made operating the car seat buckles impossible. With the Bucklebee he is able to get our son out of his car seat for the first time. I like that the material is plastic, so it doesn't get hot if the car is parked in the sun. Also, because it stays attached to the belt, you don't have to worry about losing it.
Love this handy gadget! I thought it seemed expensive...totally worth the money.

I love this product! We purchased it for our little one a few months before her 4th birthday because she could unbuckle the top of her 5 point car seat but not the bottom. She would attempt it every time we were in the car and become very frustrated at not being as independent as her older brother. I would have given it 5 stars but we did have a few issues. The product does still require a bit of strength and nearly perfect positioning. It took her a few days of practicing over and over and over again before she could use it correctly consistently. As determined as she was to be able to do it she did become a little frustrated before she got there. It may just be our car seat but it has to be pretty much dead center on the buckle for her to be able to undo it. The only other issue that we had is that it would come off a lot until recently. I am not sure if she was twisting it too much when using it but after a few uses it inevitably end up sliding off of the strap. I do have to say that now that we have had it for a while and she has become proficient with it that has become less of an issue.
We bought this for my mom to be able get my baby out of her car seat. It's perfect and makes it so easy for her to use. Great product!

So great to have my son be able to get himself out of his car seat!  My son is five and he just loves that he can get himself out of his own seat now.  Great product and I would definitely recommend this to my friends.
Genius!  My hands are so terrible with arthritis I was afraid I could not take my grand daughter out of her carseat so when I kept her we were housebound and bored. Not anymore! This works great!!

These are the best. I have twin 4-1/2 year olds so I had to buy a lot of these to fit all the car seats (my car, hubby's car, grandparents') I wish they would sell these at discount when you have to buy a lot of them.
My son still struggles to use it well and it doesnt always stay on the buckle...but I can see the value in it for people who need a little extra leverage.

Bought this for my 5 year old, who has a hard time unbuckling the bottom of the 5 point harness on her Britax pinnacle 90 seat. Since she started school, it has become important for her to be able to get out by herself in carpool. This is a great little device that works as advertised!
Works as described. Great way for a responsible child to get out of their seat themselves. It does take a little practice.
This has been great for my very petite 10yo who is still in a 5-point harness. She loves the independence! We bought one for each car plus Grandma's!

I bought this after my 3 year old accidentally got locked in our van at a gas station. She was in no immediate danger, but I had to wait 30 minutes for my husband to arrive while trying to play games with her through the glass. I knew then she was old enough that she needed to be able to get herself out of her seat in certain situations. If it had been a hot summer day, my goofy charades in a parking lot would have been a frantic 911 call. We've been using this for over 6 months and I still love it. She's 4 now, but still doesn't have the dexterity to unbuckle herself without the Bucklebee. I highly recommend this for a kiddo you trust not to unbuckle themselves in dangerous situations. You know your kid. I wish they had these when my oldest was younger. She needed someone to unbuckle her seat all the way until she grew out of it at 5.
Very cool!! It's very helpful so my daughter can do it her self!

I do not understand why anyone would give this a one, two, or even three star review. This works exactly as advertised. Before we got this, my 5 year old daughter could not unbuckle the bottom part of her car seat, and would have to wait for me to help her. I was thinking about how I am going to make this easier for her and me when she stars kindergarten. And then I found this product! It works perfectly. She is able to unbuckle with absolutely no issue.  It lays down flat when it is not in use, it clips on my daughters car seat with absolutely no issues. I love this product and wish I would have bought it sooner. I absolutely recommend it!

This thing is fantastic! I was so sick of having to twist around behind my seat to unbuckle my 5 year old so I decided to give this a try. It's easy for her to use and doesn't get in the way of anything!
Works perfectly! My son can easily unbuckle his carseat on his own with this, where as before someone would have to help him. Makes drop off at school in the car line possible.
With 4 kids to unload, this things saves me oodles of time and frustration. A great product to help foster independence in preschoolers. Thank you!

We love our Bucklebee but have to be very careful because our little one has unbuckled herself while still driving. She knows now we have to say "Bucklebee" and that means she can take her seatbelt off. Very easy to use and glad we purchased it.
One of the best thing I have ever bought. Getting a child out of a car seat is a chore in itself with this product it makes it a lot easier

This has made my life so much easier! My six-year-old sits in the third row of our minivan and while she is able to click herself in, I still had to crawl back there to tighten her seat belt and then to unbuckle the bottom clip of her Graco carseat when getting out. Thanks to this device, I only have to tighten her seat belt now. This should be on every baby registry!

After the first day of kindergarten drop off we realized we were in trouble. My 5 year old could not unbuckle her car seat and we attempted to practice and just had no luck. I found this and hoped it would help. It does! She is able to get out easily now! I can't recommend this product enough. We are going to be buying one for my 3 year old soon so that after my 5 year old gets out she can undo her sisters buckle. They are in the back row of the van and it is hard for me to get back there. I'm so glad I found these!
This product is so easy for my son to use and is quite a time saver! It is quality made and very afforadable. Such a genius idea, every parent should own a Bucklebee!!

I have moderate neuropathy in both hands and ordered this product after I couldn't get my daughter out of her car seat one day for school and had to ask another parent for help. It has a been a life-saver! Literally I'm sure, as I panicked after that day thinking, what would I do if I had to get her out in an emergency?! The Bucklebee is so easy to use. My 4 year old is able to get herself out as well - sometimes I have to help hold my hand behind the buckle to provide support but she pushes it on her own. I have two children in car seats and have been using one Bucklebee for both seats when needed, although one seat is easier to unbuckle for some reason. It is easy to take off one seat and use on another if necessary. Will be ordering another soon!

I wish I would have bought this a year ago! My 6 1/2 year old is still safely in a 5 point in the 3rd row of my odyssey. Every morning I have to climb through my van to release him from his harness in the drop off lane for school. This allows him to unbuckle himself and exit the car all on his own. Love it! Great product for kids who are responsible enough to not unbuckle unless they ask for permission first.

I was looking for something to help my 4.5 year old unbuckle herself from the third row. She is in a Sunshine Radian and can undo the top buckle herself. This wasn't as easy for her as I had hoped. With the width of her belt, you need a bit of leverage to push the button. That being said, after some practice and sheer determination, she can now do it herself. I imagine this would be easy for adults with arthritis who understand leverage and button placement. It was eventually possible for a 4 year old. It was very easy to install and definitely worth it overall.
Great product! Easy to hook up and easy to use! My 4 y/o loves being able to get out by himself when we reach our destination! I wish this product was invented sooner!
Awesome product - my kindergartner can now unbuckle herself for school drop off!
Excellent product for arthritic hands...
I am so so happy that my kindergartner can get out of her seat on her own! It makes going places SO much better! She is so proud of herself and that makes me happy as well!

My son and DIL have 4 kids that are 4 and under, so getting all 4 buckled into and out of car seats is a challenge.  We bought one of these for the 4 year old's car seat, and he had no trouble unbuckling himself, and was very proud of being able to do this with no help.  We bought a second one for the 3 year old, but his car seat is a different brand, and they are having difficulty getting this attached to his.  (DIL said she thought it would go on eventually, but they were going to have to take the straps out and straightened, to figure out how to make it work.  3 year old reminds them EVERY time they go somewhere that this need to be done!)  Obviously, every car seat is different, so it's impossible to make something like this that is truly universal, so keep that in mind when purchasing.  And probably not all kids can be trusted with a tool that allows them to undo their own seat belt, but this has not been an issue with them.  Highly recommend this!
These things have saved my sanity as the mom of a 5 and a 3 yr old. They can totally let themselves out of their car seats ALL BY THEMSELVES. Buy this, you'll be grateful you did.
This is a fantastic product! It is a great tool to help my son unbuckle himself in car line. Works like a charm on the tricky bottom buckle.

This little device is awesome!! I bought it for my nearly 6 year old son to use, as he's very small (only 37lbs) and will need to be in a 5 point harness style car seat for quite a while longer. Now he can unbuckle himself and just LOVES his Bucklebee!!! I would definitely recommend this device to parents with older children who understand car seat safety and know they can only unbuckle once the car is parked.

I love the concept of this product!  While the video depicts a very easy use of this product, I must admit that I had some issues in using it at first, but I finally mastered it.  Here are some tips that I learned while trying to master the Bucklebee so that it operates more smoothly for any other buyers of the Bucklebee. *First of all, make sure that the seat belt fits snuggly on your child. *Secondly, if the Bucklebee fits loosely and slides up and down easily on the seat belt itself, make sure your child or grandchild slides the Bucklebee up to the base of the buckle lock with one hand, and operates the Buclebee lock release with "both" hands to unbuckle. *Lastly, be sure that the Bucklebee is being used straight and flat and "not" being turned or twisted sideways to be released.  This will make it hard for your child or grandchild to release the seat belt because it will not be an even preasure for both seat belts to release on the 5 point restraint at the same time. It will take some practice for your child or grandchild to master the correct position to place their hands and how much pressure to apply.  This is normal, they are learning a new concept.  It is all part of learning to be independant.  However, once they master the use of the Bucklebee, they are going to LOVE it and so will you as a parent or grandparent!  I HIGHLY recommend the Buckelbee!  I LOVE IT!

BLUF:  Safe, effective product that responsible parents can use with disciplined practice. I dont like non-safety products with giant warnings: Im a combat veteran, a husband and father. Disclaimers and warnings dont bring back kids so I was skeptical and stress tested this item before using it with my children. So I tried this in a 2015 Toyota Avalon and 2014 Honda Odyssey driven by a combat driver with a weighted doll (think: EMT training tool/CPR dummy). Regardless of the hard stops (60mph rapid deceleration; 25mph sharp turn LF and RT; short stops), rapid acceleration (0-60; 30-60; 0-25 hairpin LF and RT) and weaving with braking the buckle did not release. HOWEVER, once my 5 year old was in the seat, he immediately was able to use the Bucklebee. This means two things: 1. I am responsible for my childs safety and whether he is ready to use this (that whole being accountable and parenting responsibilities concept) 2. We needed to practice this process and ensure he was prepared. So we did and all was well. No problems (didnt even need to adjust the straps). I didnt find five dollars. My story is anticlimactic because the Bucklebee works well but doesnt create problems. Be responsible, talk to your kids and it will work well. If they can handle it, then it will be great not to have to dive backwards into the backseat to unbuckle them at drop off each day. Its been great for us.

britax.review: So easy to use with the Britax car seats our 3 and 5 year olds have.  The design looks like it will be universally usable for all other car seats as well.  And the kids love saying "buckle bee bee bee bee!"

We bought these because we were recently in a car accident and both of my almost five year old twins are in Britax Pioneer seats.  While everyone was ok, they were in the Britax using the lap belt.  While perfectly legal, it made me really want them to be in the 5 point harness again.  The problem is I was still recovering from a csection and had a new little baby that needed to be put in the middle row (she makes kiddo #4, so we have a full vehicle) and it was very difficult for me to climb in the back to buckle and unbuckle multiple times.  This allows them to unbuckle themselves (I still buckle them in every time) saving me the painful climb and stretch to buckle them up.  They are old enough to know they DO NOT unbuckle themselves until we tell them they are able.  I think this would be great for grandparents or people who have a hard time trying to push the red button in to unbuckle.  I feel completely safe with this product, and do not believe it impacts the safety of the car seats at all.
My daughter can finally unbuckled her Britax Marathon

Our six year old son can now unbuckle his own car seat which has made school drop off a lot easier! We have Britax Frontier seats and the push button is hard for adults to push and impossible for him. I was concerned about him needing to unbuckle in an emergency and not being able to do so. The only challenge is that its hard for him to get into his car seat without this sticking up and poking him.  Were going to buy two more for our other vehicle and for grandmas vehicle.

My 5yo is still in a harnesses booster seat, & we needed an easier way for her to get out of her seat in the carpool line for kindergarten. We use this on our Britax car seat, & installation was easy. It took a couple tries, but she quickly got the hang of unbuckling herself.  She uses her hips to push against the back of the buckle & easily releases it that way.  She loves the ability to get out of the car by herself, & we havent had any issues with her unbuckling without being told.  Well definitely be using this for our next child when hes a little older.

carseat.review: My 3 and 5 year olds have been able to unbuckle themselves on their own from their Britax car seats for about 8-9 months now.  We bought a Recaro harness-to-booster to replace an Evenflo car seat we had in our other car because my child outgrew it in height, that one they can unbuckle themselves too.  Both of the kids are tall and heavy enough to ride on regular backless boosters with car seat belts but we want to keep them secured in harnesses as long as possible.  We recently bought a Graco Atlas harness-to-booster for the 3 yr old because we got a great deal on it, and upon testing it out, discovered that the button on that seat is not the same square button as on mostit is a round button and is much harder to push. It took more effort from my fingers and even my 5 yr old couldn't release it to help their sibling out. This may be a good thing for some kids who are too young to know when it's OK to unbuckle and have super strong hands and can unbuckle themselves, but for us it was an inconvenience.  So much so that I thought about returning the Graco car seat, but then I remembered I'd seen this thing on Facebook or somewhere and decided to get it. I wasn't sure if it would work with the circular button, but it did.  We only slide the outside part of the belt (it's dual layer on most seats) under the bucklebee so it doesn't interfere with the car seat in any way or cause any discomfort, and my 3 yr old is now able to squeeze it onto the circular buckle to get enough torque to release the belt.  Also, it's bright yellow color makes it easy to see in the dark and helps in placing the strap forward and trying to avoid sitting on it when they climb into the seat, for easier access to it once they are sitting and trying to buckle. Having kids that can get in and out of car seats on their own is liberating.  Obviously you check to make sure they are properly buckled and the chest strap is where it should be each time, but IF you have kids whom you trust with buckling/unbuckling themselves because they're old enough and you've talked with them about the dangers of not being buckled and your kids never unbuckle themselves unless it's time to, then this will help their little hands be able to unbuckle the bottom.  If they can't unbuckle the top chest clip then this won't save you any time, so you're not ready for this yet. It saved us from having to return our new car seat.  (because we were not going to go back to the days of unbuckling a kid after having lived the good part of a year enjoying the easiness of getting in and out of cars, and because our kids enjoyed the freedom and confidence they used to have and were getting more frustrated than me with the new car seat)

My 5 year old loves it. We have 2 different carseats. Works great on both. Recommend only for older children who have learned not to unbuckle while vehicle is moving. We are not allowed to get out when he is dropped off at school. This gives him the independence to be able to get out on his own like a big boy. Makes drop off time alot easier.

This little tool has been very helpful! I am teaching my 4 year old how to buckle and unbuckle his 5 point harness on his carseat. I never thought I'd be asking my son to do this, but his parapro at school has no clue how to work a car seat. This new school gives us no time to get out to help. I can't reach him where I sit so I have to keep moving in carpool and get out onto the main road then pull over. I figured I wouldn't say anything till our next meeting which I'm hoping I can avoid it all together if my son can get this down I know its only her since his teacher came out to have me sign some papers and she strapped him in with no problems. I've asked the parapro to strap the chest part and she barely does that right. I was reaching in the back to undo the button for him while sitting for few seconds while the cop directs traffic. Most times I am barely able to do it in time. He's had this only 2 days and has gotten it almost down. After 3 days he gets himself out by the time we reach the cop and go into the school. He's able to get his book bag on and stay seated in his carseat. Like I said I really wasn't expecting to have my 4 year old learn this, but have no choice with this new schools carpool. His parapro finally started strapping him in better because I was telling him directions and guess she heard me. Thankfully I won't be bringing it up and he can get in and out of his seat now without help!

I'm a mom of 4 & I also have rheumatoid arthritis. Car seat buckles are a huge hurdle in my daily independence. As my hands have gotten weaker I rely on my oldest or husband to unbuckle the little ones & if they aren't there I have to use my keys or something else to push the button. I heard about the Bucklebee & thought I'd give it a try. It has been a game changer! My 5 yr old, who struggled to unbuckle himself, can now do his own buckle which makes him feel like a "super big boy." And I don't have to struggle getting my newborn out of his carrier. It sounds crazy but this little tool has made my life much easier. I'm able to leave the house more because I no longer have to worry that I won't be able to get someone out of their car seat. I feel more independent because I'm not relying on anyone to undo buckles for me. If you have arthritis or another condition that has affected your hand strength & you struggle with car seat buckles, the Bucklebee is a tool you need.

I won't put my 40lb child in a booster just yet. I know a five point carseat is safer for him. If your child is old enough to know when it's appropriate to let himself out of his seat, it's a great gadget! Just like the product video, it is a time saver in the school drop off line. It's also a comfort to know my child can get himself out of the car in an emergency situation.

But I don't want her to anyway!
