Would also be great for someone with weak hands or low muscle tone.  Makes pressing the button so much easier.
My 5 year old could never figure it out. We have a Diono car seat which is pretty hard to push. Maybe this would work well for a different brand of seat. It got one of the buckles out but not both.

This has been truly a blessing. I have rheumatoid arthritis really bad and was unable to get my daughter out of the car seat. Now we can go places and I don't have to depend on anyone else to get her out for me.

I was so excited when I found out this product existed. My four year old was having a hard time unbuckling himself and this was the perfect solution. Unfortunately it didn't work with our car seat. the piece that is supposed to push the button in did not reach the buckle button and kept slipping.  My son was unable to unbuckle himself with this product .  Great idea but needs a better design .

My 5 year old was having problems getting out of her car seat in the kindergarten drop off line so we decided to give this a try. It has boosted her confidence and has been great for getting her out of the third row. Plus now I am not worried about the kids being accidentally locked in the car or stuck after an accident. She is my oldest and very responsible but she is the smallest kid in her whole class and doesnt have the finger strength to push the button. Now I can leave her in the 5 point harness a whole extra year and know she is safe! My only issue is that it comes off the strap easily and I do have to reattach it about once every other week.
Hurts our child they they try to push it.
this does not work. It falls off of the buckle and even when it is on it is still too hard for my 5 year old to press. very dissapointed.

I bought these because my mom has very long artificial nails, and my natural nails are kind of long, so it was a struggle to unbuckle my kid's carseat. They work great, however, my 3 year-old is strong enough to unbuckle herself (after watching mw use it once) if I leave it attached to the leg strap. I keep it in the cup holder in the door I use. I wish it came with a stretchy strap i could attached to the side of the car seat in case of an accident.
I love the buckle bee! Unbuckling my kids car seats is so much easier now. My son hasn't quite gotten the hang of undoing his own, but it's still worth it for the effort it saves me.

As our third child will be here in a few weeks we have been trying to teach our oldest, 4yo, to push that dang button and get out of his car seat himself... especially once we move him to the third row I couldnt imagine trying to juggle all three car seats. His fingers just didnt have the strength to do it. I even looked into booster seats but quickly realized they are not as safe at this age. Google searching and I came across some buckle button that touted doesnt attach to car seat like thats a good thing. Sorry, but a small object will disappear into the vortex of my van, so being attached is a good thing! Are they afraid the child will unbuckle during a ride? Thats called lack of discipline.... Took a few minutes to explain and to get the hang of it and the second time he was able to unbuckle straight away. Third attempt and hes a pro! What a relief to have one less thing to worry about... going to buy another so he can help his 3yo brother out of his car seat as well.

We had to move my 5 year old into ther back of ther minivan because of having a third child. I knew I wouldn't be able to crawl in the back and release her from her car seat. After doing some research I came across the Bucklebee. This is a lifesaver! My daughter feels so much more independent (and is!) and I don't have to crawl in the back. It took a few trials for her to figure out how to position her body and sequence removal (it's easier to release ther bottom buckle first then undo the chest strap). Only four stars given because the Bucklebee falls off the buckle every few weeks and it's a pain for me to crawl in the back and replace it.
My just turned 4 year old just couldnt undo the buckle on his diono car seat by himself. But he got it the very first time he tried the bucklebee!

We put this on a Diono Radian RXT car seat and my 3yo had an easier time releasing her belt buckle without the Bucklebee than with. The problem is that pushing the Bucklebee in takes two hands and then there is no hand left to either pull down on the buckle or to pull up on the straps so theres not an easy way to actually get the metal pieces to slide out of the buckle even if youre successful at pushing the button in. Hope that makes sense. Compare that to when using your thumb to push the button in directly, you can use your other hand to pull up in the strap to pull the metal piece out of the buckle. Id say this is nice but not awesome.
It's super hard to use on my daughters car seat. Only allows one of the buckles to come unbuckled then it's to hard to unbuckle the other one. Not worth $15
I can finally get me grand-daughter out of her car seat!  My acrylic nails are too long and the button was recessed.

Only gave this 3 stars because it kept falling off the strap. It worked great but I did not want to keep retrieving it to reinstall. With enough practice Im finally able to unbuckle the car seat without help.

My just turned four year old didnt have the grip strength to unbuckle her car seat. It took her about a week to lean how to use it, but now she can get in and out of her car seat in the back of the minivan without my help. Thats a big deal when you have three small kids!

I popped this onto the carseat that both of my kids use (ages 3 and 5) in my parent's car to see if they could both use it.  the older one figured it out without any trouble and seemed to enjoy the extra independence in the seat with the tougher button. the younger one, with some assistance, was able to get out as well.  Caution: if you're not ok with a kid getting out of the car seat on their own or don't trust the kid to follow directions to not use this while the car is in motion, this is not for you. if you want more control , there's a different product on the market meant for the adult.  my older son enjoyed the independence and will keep it on his seat.
My 4 year old is so excited to be able to release herself from her seat once the car is parked and turned off. I would NOT recommend this if your child might possibly unbuckle while driving.
Releasing my grandson from car seat

Didn't really work with my car seat, I had to really pull on it to bring it higher to actually use it. Not easy for my 5 year old to use, which is the only reason I bought it. Would like to return it.

Is there anything more frustrating than trying to get a child out of a 5 point harness carseat? The answer is no. You are reaching in at an odd angle and trying to push a release button with the correct pressure. UGH. I asked for some help on an online forum and everyone suggested bucklebee. This has been the best thing I could have gotten to solve this problem. It attaches easily to the harness and is ready to use whenever you need it. I can push on the bucklebee and have the harness released in no time at all. I would highly recommend this for anyone who has a lack of finger strength, arthritis, or just is tired of struggling with pushing that stupid little button just right for long enough to release the harness. The only problem I see is that if you have a little escape artist you might want to keep the bucklebee elsewhere in the car and just attach it when you are actually using it. While it does take a little leverage to work it I wouldn't trust a little escape artist to leave it alone while you are driving.
Extremely hard to use...takes longer than just unbuckling with hands
Baby seats are so hard to unbuckle! But this has made it a simple task, as it should be! My mom and mother in law both have long nails and this has helped them unbuckle our son quicker!
5 yr old could not release seat belt with this tool.  Didnt have luck as described.

This thing does not work well with my grand daughters car seat. She tries and tries to no avail. I cant even get it to work correctly half the time. The problem is that it needs pressure behind the buckle in order for this to work. Thats great if you have both hands empty, but its very rare that that is the case when Im getting her out. She cant push it in and pull at the same time. I guess I need to order that other brand that is like a puncher.

Who knew bushing those red buttons on car seats could be so ridiculously hard. For the first few weeks with our LO we fought the car seat to unbuckle each time.  I had seen there was a little tool to help with this, but the ones I kept coming across seemed like they were going to be just as much of a pain to slide on each time.  Then I found the Bucklebee which you could leave on the car seat permanently.  Let me go ahead and tell you that you need one of these, its super economical, easy to use, and is going to safe you time and probably a few choice words when your trying to click that red button. This is definitely one of those life saver tools your going to want to get, and it would be a great baby shower gift that most people wont think of.
My five year old loves the fact he can now unbuckle himself when we get to where we are going

I bought this for my 4yo. He can now get himself completely unbuckled before I count to 5. I bought 3 more that night to put on all the other car seats he rides in. I'm a little salty about spending $15 on a little piece of plastic, but overall, $60 to ensure my kid doesn't get stuck in the car is worth it.
My 5 year old doesn't struggle to unlock her carseat anymore. It's been amazing to have her be independent. No more complaining!
GAME. CHANGER. My kids have never been able to undo their car seats by themselves until now! Happy momma!
Child seat belts are really hard for children to unbuckle themselves.In case of emergency your child should be able to get out.My son can now unbuckle himself without my assistance.
It doesnt help. Weve practiced and tried this product but it doesnt release our seat belt without a struggle.

I bought this to help my 5 year old son get out of his car seat. His bottom buckle is very stiff and difficult even to release with my own hands. The first time I added this to his belt, he got it on the first try and was so excited to be able to have a little more independence (with strict rules and when he can and cannot use it).

I like that this gives my 6 year old a little more independence in his car seat. He is old enough to get out when we stop now. It allows me to focus on getting the younger child in and out. I no longer have to run from one side of the vehicle to the other to get kids out.
It's too hard for my daughter to push. I'm not sure if it is because of the carseat and the angle or what. It's even hard for me.

My 4 and now 5 year old can now unbuckle herself from her 5pt harnessed car seat! Has saved my back from twisting in the car to help her push a tough lower buckle. Also helps my mom who struggled to assist her! Worth it!
Great for people who have issues pinching that little red button on a car seat.
Due to Lupus and Raynauds I have very weak painful hands.  This buckle thing has helped tremendously with the car seat buckle.  I no longer need to ask strangers to help unbuckle baby!
My 4yr old found became more confident and comfortable being in her car seat with the ability to get out.

It was a little hard for her to figure out, but after a couple tries my daughter can now get out of her car seat on her own with ease! This is great for when I drop her off at school or when we get home and I have my hands full.  I wouldn't recommend if your child isn't trust worthy to NOT unbuckle themselves while the car is moving, but my daughter knows better, so it is a great fit for our family!
My son loves that he can now get out of his car seat on his own, like a big boy

I bought this because I watch my grandchildren and I was having surgery on my hand. While I was casted, I could not use this. My cast came off and it is still very difficult to press the red button on the car seat. (I have an Evenflo). The latch falls off the car seat harness. Not impressed. I will be trying it on a different car seat next week. If the ease of use changes, I will update my review.
It didnt work on a Graco or Chicco car seat.

Your browser does not support HTML5 video. LIFE CHANGING! My 4.5 year old still could not unbuckle her bottom buckle of her car seat. She is very petite and will be in a 5 point harness for a while longer. I would have to reach over and unbuckle her in the school pick up lines, etc. or talk her brother into helping every time. This has made all the difference in the world! She got it first try and she is so proud of herself! I would definitely recommend this (as long as you feel your child is responsible enough to only unbuckle at appropriate times).

Creative invention that is nice for kids that are old enough to understand when they can and cannot unbuckle. Fits a bit looser on our one car seat that has a thin groin buckle compared to our other seat that has a thicker buckle strap.

My grandson will be 5 yrs old in three months and is all about safety! That being said, We love Bucklebee! He is capable of getting his car seat belts off, opening the door, getting out, then immediately putting his hand on the lid to the gas tank, so as to not run around in a parking lot. And perfect for when arriving home after a long day. Also we are very selective and cautious where we let him do this. It is giving him a lot of independence and relieving us of a small struggle and less stress. Occasionally it will come off the belt but he is capable of getting it back on pretty quickly. A little pricey but would definitely buy again!
My 4 year old loves the independence this gives him to unbuckle his own carseat! And I love not climbing into the minivan to help him every time.

Works great on my child's convertible carseat...Maxi Cosi Pria 85 Max. Being able to attach it to the buckle strap is a huge plus. We had a different brand unbuckler before that worked great, but it was constantly being dropped or lost.  I would repurchase the Bucklebee over the other brand for that reason.
Great for those carseat buttons!! Bout broke my fingers pushing them sometimes and this makes it a ton easier

This is a Grandmas review. I was desperate trying to exert enough pressure to unlock my granddaughters car seat and Bucklebee was a life saver. 5 stars except that is has slipped off (or got picked off) the locking strap - frustrated me when it happened.
It doesnt stay attached to car seat. Kept coming off car seat through hole in plastic.
It would occasionally come off as my kid would buckle themselves in but worked well to get them out.

We have these on both are car seats! My 5 year old daughter loves that she can get out of the car seat independently now! I would say you do need to make sure your child is mature enough so they dont try and play with it or try to get out of seat while the vehicle is moving.
My grandson can now get himself out of the car seat he wasnt able to at first, but now that hes six , no problem
My 5 year old grandchildren love that they are able to unlock the car seat themselves to get out of the car at school drop off
My son was super excited to be able to finally get out of the car seat by himself.
My daughter has one on her car seat, so I bought one.  My four year old grandson can help undo his seat.

Don't waste your money did not work so complecated to use ur shelf and your Child to unbuckle them selfs and I had bought 2 for both carseats what a waste their purpose of making good idea but did not work at all

Product performance matches description, but its bulky and uncomfortable. Purchased so grandparents can easily unbuckle our car seats, but it is bulky and pinches Kiddo. Was also hoping the product could easily and quickly assist Kiddo and me in carpool lines, but the product is not a fast and simple tool - you must have the product attached to the belt part of the thigh clip for it to function, keeping it attached pinches Kiddo when not in use.

graco.review: The idea behind this product is genius. However we find that they don't really work all that well with our seats (Graco Nautilus). Not sure whether this is particular to our seat brand/model or just a product that isn't quite as good as advertised. My 5-year-old can sometimes undo his buckle using the Bucklebee but it definitely isn't easy. I've tested it out and it's not easy for me, either! For the price I would have expected a more effective and easier to use product. I had been hoping it would work better and I could buy them for my 3-year-old as well, but there's no point as she will certainly not be strong enough to use these. Still wishing for a better solution.

We own a Graco transitions 3-in-1 car seat and my 4 yr old has a hard time trying to get the notch to press the button in aligned with the button. Almost as if the neck of the buckle bee needs to be a little longer. He's able to eventually get the buckle off but it takes some time. And you have to make sure the entire belt part of the buckle is through the loop of the buckle bee in order to really work. Overall my son over time will get better at it. Makes it easier at times for him to get out of his seat.
My son has to be able unbuckle himself for kindergarten. He couldn't do the bottom buckle. He is in a Graco Nautilus seat. This works perfectly and he can get out independently.
Was hard to operate..ergonomics were off a bit
Does not work in my Graco child seat.
We have 2 car seats. The only worked well with our graco one not the other. It makes life much easier!

toddler.review: My 3 1/2 year old son is so excited to get in and out of his car seat now - with this he is able to completely unbuckle himself.  He's in a Graco 3-in-1 Nautilis car seat, and this release works very well with his car seat.  I will definitely be buying it again when my other son gets older :)
My 4 year old loves it!

Although the Bucklebee has made it possible for me to unbuckle my grand daughter, I still have some trouble while using it.  DO NOT LEAVE IT ON THE STRAP WHILE DRIVING!  I told my three year old not to touch it and had hardly started driving when she informed me she had unbuckled her belt!!!
When my two toddlers are in the 3rd row it's hard for me to climb back there and unbuckle them! Now they do it themselves! This is a great tool!
My 4 year old can now undo her seat no more Climbing into the back of the van
Has made school drop off easier now that my youngest can unbuckle himself!
Finally my youngest can unbuckle himself! Thanks!!!

This is my second bucklebee purchase. Great product just as long as your child understands not to unbuckle when driving. Easy for my 3 1/2 year old to use, and she gets excited when she unbuckles herself.
I bought this for my 3 year old son. He can now unbuckle himself when dropping off st school.

It wasn't as easy for my 3 year old to use as we thought it would be, but she is able to use it. We plan to buy another for our other younger child. It took her some time to get it down and now she can do it, but it still takes some effort.

I have severe Rheumatoid Arthritis and I wish I had known about this sooner. I severely sprained my wrist and found myself outside my house crying because I couldnt get him out of his seat. It made me scared to go anywhere on my own. I do not leave it attached my son is only 2 1/2. I keep it in the door where it wont get lost and he cant reach. I love it so so much.
Did not work. Tried many times and couldnt get it to work nor could my 4 year old son (which is the reason I bought it). Returned it
My four year old sits in a Diono, he was able to free himself after a week. He now sits in the third row of our SUV & can buckle and unbuckle himself.

Took my almost 3 year old a little while to get the hang of it, but once he did, it was AWESOME. Hes pretty laid back, so hes only unbuckled when he wasnt supposed to a couple of times when we were parked and he just wanted to get out.
Not as handy as I expected. It is difficult for my 4 year old to use and uncomfortable for her if I leave it on. She asked me to remove it after a couple of days and hadn't used it since.
My 4 year old could not unbuckle herself and we could not adequately reach her in the third row. She quickly took to this and can now get herself unbuckled.
only my 5 year old can work it. my 3 year old can't yet.
My son cant use it.
Im not sure if its my kiddo that had a problem using it, if its not as compatible with his seat but its hit or miss when he can get it open. Doesnt save me the time I was expecting it to.

My four year old was able to unbuckle his bottom buckle by himself for the pre-k drop off line! This was a game changer since we are not allowed out of the car to unbuckle him. Thanks bucklebee for making our drop off an easier experience!
My daughter 3 years of age was able to use this & unlatch her car seat!
My kindergartener can get himself unbuckled now.
My 4 year old grandson can get out of the car seat without my help.  Ive always thought something like this was needed in case of an emergency and couldnt be reached.

My 4 year old got frustrated a lot at first but now can do it easily. We did have to stitch a Lin in the strap so this lever would have more tension. Its a life saver to have her unstrap herself now. It just has a learning curve.
This product is hard for my 3.5 year old to use. She can get it to unlock sometimes, but most of the time I still have to help her.
Was hoping my 4 year old could use this to unbuckle herself but she cant, and is hurts her leg as shes climbing in.
Works well. Now my toddler and grandma have no issues unbuckling.

We got the Bucklebee for my 2 year old son after we had to climb in the 3rd row and buckle/unbuckle him. We have had it for a few months and he doesn't quite use it himself, but he likes to talk about it and understands what it does and when not to push it! It definitely makes it easier for all family members to get him in and out of the car!
My 4 year old boy figured out how to use it almost instantly. This will come in handy when my new baby is born. He will be able to unbuckle all by himself.

My 4 year old got the hang of this immediately. He LOVES the independence & pride that comes with being able to unbuckle himself and I love knowing that in an emergency he has the ability to get out of his seat without assistance.
My 4 year old is able to unbuckle herself and she couldn't be happier about it.

I didnt like the idea for this  product at first thinking it would allow my child to get out of their car see you whenever they want. I have stress to both my children ages 4 & 3 not to  use it until the vehicle is stocked and I say unbuckle. I havent had any problems. It makes it so much easier to get them out and their  grandparents are so happy with this product as well
My littles love being able to get themselves out of their seats and my oldest likes being able to get his brother out without hurting his fingers.

I got this for my mom because she has long nails and has a hard time getting my toddler out of the car seat. We found out though, that my daughter LOVES to get herself out! So we got one for my car too. Speeds up to process of getting everyone in and out! Love it!
Great product and perfect for my independent 3yo who refuses to let anyone help her unbuckle
My toddler doesn't have the strength in his hands to unstrap himself but he's at that stage where he wants his independence and doesn't want me to help him! So this tool is great for both of us!
This has been a back saver for me!! I no longer have to crawl back into the way back of my vehicle to help my 3 year old unbuckle! He absolutely loves the fact that he can unbuckle himself also.
My 3 year was able do it first try. It still takes some hand strength to use it It helps me get him out more quickly
Toddler still not strong enough to use but older kids helps with school drop off. Thanks
Hard for 4 year old to use
My 4 year old can finally unbuckle himself! Thank you!!!
Now my 3.5 year old can help by getting himself out of the car. He knows not to unbuckle while we are driving and it's a huge help for him to get out by himself now.

I wasn't too sure about this product but I decided to give it a whirl because my youngest was still unable to unbuckle to ease in the carpool drop off line at school. He was so excited the first time he used it because he was in awe that he unbuckled himself!
Great product. So easy for my 2 year old to use.
Got this for my 3 year old. Tried it out and he is able to unbuckle himself with this.

This has saved my thumbs from strain. Those car seat releases are difficult for arthritic hands and this little device helps immensely. I no longer am standing and fighting with that red button to get our 3 yearold grandson out of his carseat.

I would not recommend this for children under 5 like a toddler whos going to unbuckle when your driving down the highway is not a good idea but my girls are 5/6 they no not to unbuckle till Im in park. Since they are going to be a five point till they graduate college (not literally obviously when they start driving at 16 they cant be in one) this will be very useful. I am very happy that they can fully unbuckle themselves now with this. It is smaller than I thought it was and does not fit as perfect as I hoped but it still works as intended. I also like that Incase of emergency they can get out of the car seat themselves if need be.

I purchased for my 4year old to use to help him get out on his own. Its still to difficult for him because you have to hold the back of the buckle and then push on the device to make it work for him. He is a very thin and petite kid. So may work on a child with a larger frame. However it is a help to me when my nails are longer and I don't have to risk breaking one to unbuckle him.
Way ok difficult for our toddler; we returned. I found it tough as an adult.

My LO had a hard time using this. She had a hard time aligning both bucklebee and the center of her buckle. it also was too slippery and just made her more frustrated. Tried to return but it kept returning back to the return page. a bit annoying

Ease of use. My 4 year old sits behind the passenger seat in the van and my 2 year old behind me the driver. Bucklebee or his "key" as we call it, has helped so much. It took him a little bit to get the hanger of but now has no trouble getting himself out. Now I have made it very clear that he must ask to use his key or I tell him to unlock his seatbelt. It has happened while I was driving and his teddy fell on the floor and he wanted to get it. I have taken the key away for a day or so but he learned real quick to wait for Mommy. Now I can have him unbuckle and come out my daughter / the sidewalk side, anytime. Love it.

I got this release buckle for my very smart 4 year old in that unbuckles herself once we arrive at our destination and its a waste of money. Its always slipping off or it wont reach the buckle. I myself have trouble using it so I just removed it.
A great idea, but it came off too easily. The toddler's either unbuckled themselves or took the tool off. Sigh.

harness.review: This has made a significant difference for our eldest daughter.  She was able to get out of her convertible car seat by herself. When she moved to the 5 point harness at age 5 she was no longer strong enough, mature enough, just not physically able.  Sitting in the back of the van at the school drop-offs were frustrating until the BUCKLEBEE!

Wow! This has been a lifesaver! With four kids in car seats and boosters, I had to have at least one kid in the BACK with 5point harness. This made it so much easier for my 6yr old to unbuckle herself when we get to our destination.

I bought this for my 6 year old daughter who has a very difficult time trying to unbuckle her 5 point harness car seat. It has been such a great help in our car pick up and drop off lines at school! When my 3 year old is able to be trusted not to unbuckle when not supposed to I will be getting one for him as well!

These work great for my older kids in 5 point harness. They are not super easy to use so that a 2 year old could get out but my 4 year old leaves it be until I give permission. I ordered one for each vehicle but they can easily be transferred if you one

Love this! We have four children in five point harness car seats. We bought this for our older two who sit in the very back of the van (5&3.5). This has made parent drop off so much easier for the teachers and my son. Gives him the independence he desires and a quicker drop off time (the teachers had to unbuckle him). *I wouldn't recommend this for younger children who will just unbuckle when they feel like it*

I got this for my five year old because he sits in our third row and it's hard for me to climb back there to let him out.  Once I taught him how to use it and that he cannot do it until the car has stopped and has been turned off, this has been a life saver for me.  Once my three year old is old enough to understand how to properly use it, I plan to get one for him also.  I want to keep my kids in a 5-point harness as long as possible and this helps me achieve that.

I was pretty skeptical about this thing, but it works perfectly. My daughter is so excited she can get out of her booster (still in five point harness booster) all by herself. The button was just too hard on her little thumbs, but this worked like a charm!

I got the Bucklebee for my then 3 1/2 year old.  His inability to unbuckle his harness frustrated him.  And I get it!  Some of those buckles take a lot of thumb strength.  Since putting the Bucklebee on his strap, things have been much easier.  He loves his independence. Some naysayers have stayed kids would unbuckle themselves while the car is moving.  Obviously if your child would do that, this might not be for them.
My five year old who is still in a five point harness is now able to undo her bottom buckle! This is great so I don't have to climb into the third row to let her out.

I got this for my petite 5 year old daughter who just started kindergarten. As a "big girl" now, I was hoping she would be able to unbuckle herself in her 5-point harness. We tried it for 2 weeks and she simply couldn't get the alignment right and/or  couldn't press down hard enough to unbuckle the bottom buckle. We tried over and over, with different approaches, but she'd just get frustrated and ask me to unbuckle it.  Unfortunately, it simply didn't work for us.

My 4 year old is still in a 5 point harness, he loves that he can now get in and out of the car all by himself. Super nice for me so I don't have to climb into the back of our Suburban to unbuckle him. Works perfectly!
Grandkids love their bucklebees!!

This product is very helpful for kids who are old enough to understand that the car needs to have reached it's destination before they use the product. It is safer to keep a child in a 5 point harness for as long as possible, and very useful for them to have the independence to get out alone, especially in something like a school drive-line.  My 4 year old has just started to use this product in her new forward facing car seat (Cosco Finale) and it will be great to be able to keep her in the harness and use the drive-line for Kindergarten next year. I also like to think that it could make it easier for a child to get out of the car in an accident type situation.

This is helping keep my oldest daughter in a 5 point harness for longer.  We thought about switching to a booster since she would fit but now she is able to buckle and unbuckle herself therefore keeping her in the 5 point harness.  She sits where I cant climb in to reach her when getting in and out so she needs to be independent.  She is mature enough not to unbuckle while moving.

I bought this for my daughter to use during Carline. She started kindergarten still in her 5-point harness and wasn't able to unbuckle her own seat. This worked like a charm. I felt she was mature enough to keep it on her seat at all times, but if your child is an escape artist, I'd probably pass.

I loved the idea of this. I wanted it to work SO bad for my 5 year old who still uses a 5 point harness carseat. He can get the top buckle but struggles with the bottom. Unfortunately this didn't help at all. It actually just got in the way. If I wasn't so sure it would be a lifesaver and threw away the packaging as soon as I opened it, I'd return it. Eager parents, keep the packaging.
We have kept our kids in harnesses as long as possible and this allowed them to be able to get themselves out so I no longer needed to crawl in.
This does not fit all car seats. The part that pushed the button doesnt reach the button on my sons five point harness booster and he is so disappointed. He was very excited to order it.
My 5 year old loves this tool. It helps her get herself out of her 5 point harness seat (when she's instructed to do so). It will help tremendously in car line so she can get out quickly!
Our 6 year old loves that she can be independent while still being safely secured in her Britax Frontier 5 point harness.

I got this for my daughter who is 5 and still in a 5 point harness seat. She has never been able to get herself out so in order to help her get some independence, we tried this. She can now get out and we all love it. It also makes me feel better knowing if there were any emergency, she could get out quickly.
My 6 yr old could not get himself out of his 5 point harness but with this device it's a breeze!! School drop off is less stressful now <3
So excited I found this!!! I still keep my 7 year old in a 5 point harness. Hes on the smaller side. And he hated that he couldnt get himself out. Well....NOW HE CAN!!! Great for him..great for me!

Wonderful, our daughter is in a booster that has a harness with much taller strap settings available for kids which is nice because the harness is safer, but our daughter is also very petite and unable to open the buckle on her own.  The only problem we have is the piece that pushes the latch is a tad too low making it more difficult than it should be, but it still allows her to unbuckle herself for school drop-off etc and feel like a big girl.

What a great idea. My 5 year old is still in a 5-point harness. He's able to buckle himself in but always struggles to unbuckle. This has given him the autonomy to do it himself. Of course we wouldn't use this if he was the type of child who unbuckles when he isn't supposed to. It took him one try to learn how to use it and it saves us time because we already have to buckle and unbuckle his baby brother. What a great purchase. So worth it!
My almost 5 year old is in a 5 point harness and hated that she couldnt be independent and unbuckle herself. This allows her to do so easily.

My five year old is in a five point harness. This makes it so much easier for him to release his crotch buckle and get himself out. Highly recommend for older children who know not to unbuckle without permission!

I keep my little boys in a 5-point harness car seat. The one my oldest son sits in is hard for him to get out of and this contraption has been a God send! No more tears freaking out at the morning school drop off line!

My 4yr old can now unbuckle herself.  She is in a 5pt harness and could always unbuckle the top independently, but could never master the bottom buckle.  This stays in place and makes getting out of the car much easier!

We bought this for my 4.5 year old so he can unbuckle himself when we get to school and make drop off go a little faster. He absolutely loves feeling independent! Once he got the hang of it, it has been easy for him to use. My only concern would be for children who dont listen well or are a little defiant. I worry that they might unbuckle when they shouldnt. That just depends on your kiddo! Otherwise, I would definitely recommend this to families with littles in a 5 point harness!
This is not strong enough to release my daughter's 5 point harness.
Our 5 yo twin girls are now able to open the 5 point harness on their car seats which was an immense help at the drop off line. It took about a week of use for them to figure it out for themselves.
Didnt stay on the seat belt. I wanted to like this but it didnt last

review_types.best_review: This thing is amazing! I bought two, because this item had lower reviews and I wanted to make sure what I got worked.  But I loved the idea that the buckle bee stays on the seatbelt latch and doesnt have to be stored on a keychain or in a door pocket. Tried the other one first-  it worked but was such a pain to get around the bulky lower buckle latch that I knew it wasnt going to work for my kids. I have three kids and we just found out were having twins! So its VITAL that my older ones can get my toddler out on their own lol. With that in mind, I pulled out the buckle bee next and put it on the lower latch belt- super easy, even with my car seat latch being very bulky. WORKS LIKE A CHARM. Even my toddler can operate it when shes told to! I love this thing- dont know why other versions of unbuckle helpers are even purchased instead. The plastic is thicker and seems more resilient than the other (very popular) product I tried, its super cute with the little bee, and you dont have to take it off and store (and lose) it! Unless you need to for a toddler that can do it themselves at inopportune times! ;) as a disclaimer, my kids are unusually highly coordinated ;)) lol! Super stoked about this Buckle Bee and will definitely recommend!
review_types.worst_review: Taking five minutes to push the button to release your kid? Not anymore!!! This this is a must! My car seat is a britax but the button is just as hard as in any seat. This little doo-dad makes getting your kid out a snap! Worried hell get out on his own? Nope! Not at 6 months anyways. He doesnt even know its there. It rests out of the way. Side note: I have rheumatoid arthritis and the button was killing my thumbs/fingers and this completely alleviates this!
review_types.neutral: I bought this for my 3 year old son. He can now unbuckle himself when dropping off st school.
